thread.title: Fulton Hornets win NCMC showdown against Boonville, 47-13
thread.title_full: Fulton Hornets win NCMC showdown against Boonville, 47-13

author: Chris Bowie
title: Fulton Hornets win NCMC showdown against Boonville, 47-13
text: Fulton Hornets win NCMC showdown against Boonville, 47-13   Oct. 5, 2015 at 9:01 AM   Oct. 5, 2015 at 9:01 AM Fulton Boonville Pirates football coach Barry Blank had two goals he wanted the Pirates to accomplish Friday night on the road against the Fulton Hornets in NCMC action. With the Hornets coming in at 5-1 overall compared to 2-4 for the Pirates, Blank said he wanted the team to come out fast to start both halves against Fulton. As it turned out, it was the Hornets who got off to a fast start with 14 unanswered points in the first quarter and a 13-7 edge in the third quarter to beat Boonville by a score of 47-13. While the loss dropped Boonville to 2-5 overall and 1-4 in the NCMC, Blank said he knew the Hornets had a lot of weapons offensively and were coming in with a lot of confidence. “They are a good team,”Blank said, “and it didn’t help that we came out flat. We talked to our kids about starting fast but then they get off to a 14-0 lead after we muffed a punt. I thought we were in the game even though we were down 27-6 at the half. Then, in the second half, we come out and score to cut the lead to a two score game and then let them drive down the field on a 11-play drive. We have to find our confidence and ourselves as a team. It’s just an attitude that our kids have to really believe it that you can fight through adversity.” The Pirates faced plenty of adversity Friday night. Aside from playing from behind all night, it didn’t help that Fulton hit paydirt on its second possession of the game after a muffed punt by Boonville. But that’s exactly what happened as the Hornets took advantage of a short field by scoring on a 19-yard run from senior running back Travis Dean to make it 7-0 with 7:35 left in the first quarter. Dean also scored on a 50-yard run after the Pirates turned the ball back over to Fulton on downs at the Hornets 20. However, on the sixth play of the drive, Dean broke several tackles on his way to the end zone for his second touchdown to extend the lead to 14-0. Although Dean and quarterback Devin Masek figured on all seven touchdowns by the Hornets, the Pirates had their chances while cutting the lead to eight at 14-6 after a six-yard run by junior running back Keon Johnson with 11:20 left in the second quarter. Meanwhile, after exchanging punts, Fulton came back with a seven-play drive from its own 43 to hit paydirt for the third time on a 2-yard run by Masek to push the lead to 20-6. The Pirates had two three and outs to closeout the half while Fulton struck again on a 16-yard run by Dean with 55 seconds remaining to go in at the half on top by a score of 27-6. Page 2 of 3 - The Hornets also dominated in the stat column in the first half with 11 first downs along with 176 yards rushing and another 115 passing for a total of 291. Boonville, meanwhile, finished the first half with four first downs along with 111 yards rushing and 17 passing for a total of 128. As for Dean, the senior running back had more total yards than Boonville as a team with 14 carries for 177 yards and three touchdowns. However, for the Pirates, Keon Johnson rushed five times for 78 yards and one score in the first half. With the Hornets pretty much controlling the first half, Boonville got the break they were looking for to start the third quarter when junior Remington Hammers intercepted a batted ball at the Fulton 23. Two plays later from the 1-yard, junior quarterback Nick Zeitlow scored on a quarterback keeper with 10:18 left to cut Fulton’s lead to 14 at 27-13. The Pirates never got any closer in the ballgame as Fulton came back with three straight touchdowns on a 10-yard run by Masek after a 11-play drive with 5:28 remaining to extend the lead to 34-13. Then, after another punt by Boonville, the Hornets struck again on a 88-yard pass from Masek to Alec Fleetwood to make it 40-13 with 2:19 left. Then, after a fumble by Boonville at the Fulton 24, the Hornets went to the air again on a 8-yard scoring strike from Masek to Isaac Franklin to lead the Pirates 47-13. While the Pirates finished the second half with one touchdown, one fumble and two punts, Fulton made the most of its opportunities with three touchdowns out of five possessions. As for the final stats for the game, Fulton accumulated 19 first downs along with 309 yards rushing and another 217 passing for a total of 526. Boonville, meanwhile, had nine first downs along with 201 yards rushing and only 17 passing for a total of 218. Dean finished the game with 23 carries for 242 yards and three touchdowns while Masek had 10 carries for 21 yards and two scores. For Boonville, Johnson had 11 carries for 114 yards and one touchdown while Jordan Weaver added 11 carries for 37 yards and Dalton Bealmer seven carries for 28 yards. Masek and Zeitlow also had all of the passing yards for their respective teams. As for receiving yards, Fleetwood led the Hornets with one catch for 83 yards and one touchdown while Radarion Glover had three catches for 64 yards. For Boonville, Adam Edler had one catch for 16 yards. On the defensive side of the ball for Boonville, Weaver had 12 solo stops and two assisted passes while Keandre Anderson added five solo stops and four assisted tackles, Weston Fahrenbrink with six and one, Remington Hammers with three and four, Adam Lixey with five and one, Ben Eichelberger with two and three, Makiah Waibel with three and one, Bryce Fuemmeler and Kole Ficken each with two and one, Brandon Johnson with one and two and Keon Johnson and Dalton Bealmer each with one solo stop. Page 3 of 3 - Lixey also had three tackles for losses and two sacks while Hammers finished the game with one interception.
